intro: Hieracium serinense, commonly known as the silverleaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of silver-white, woolly leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant has a creeping growth habit with stolons that help it spread vegetatively. It is often considered a weed due to its aggressive growth and ability to colonize various habitats.
